text: Three ships of the Royal Navy have borne the name HMS Walrus after the marine mammal: * was a W-class destroyer launched in 1917. She ran aground in 1938, was refloated and then broken up. * was an aircraft transporter launched in 1945 and renamed HMS Skua in 1953. She was sold into mercantile service in 1962. * was a Porpoise-class submarine launched in 1959, sold in 1987 and scrapped in 1991. Category:Royal Navy ship names
title: HMS Walrus
